channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Coca-Cola is going reverse Yankee by selling €1 billion of Euro debt to cover a potential tax charge
item.description: The beverage company has been in a long-drawn dispute with tax authorities in the U.S. over a $16 billion charge that it could possibly owe.

item.title: Wealthy investors find opportunities in stock market sell-offs
item.description: Wealth advisors say their clients saw the drop in stock prices as an opportunity for tax savings and estate planning.

item.title: Podcast: Why the ‘market meltdown’ puts more pressure on AI and Big Tech
Fed president throws doubt onto September rate cut Wall Street is desperate for
item.description: "We should be looking for the worst in the data rather than the best."

item.title: JPMorgan Chase is giving its employees an AI assistant powered by ChatGPT maker OpenAI
item.description: The move by JPMorgan, the largest U.S. bank by assets, shows how quickly generative AI has swept through America since the arrival of ChatGPT in late 2022.

item.title: Trump calls for a ‘say’ in Fed policy as he bashes central bank
Apple changes up App Store rules in Europe once again as EU threat of non-compliance grows
item.description: The commission said it "will assess Apple's eventual changes to the compliance measures, also taking into account any feedback from the market, notably developers".

item.title: The hedge fund trade unwind that jolted Wall Street this week may continue to agitate markets
item.description: Previous instances show a process that took years to calm.

item.title: Delta says it’ll take $380 million ‘direct’ revenue hit from CrowdStrike outage
Delta expects $380 million in lost sales from the CrowdStrike outage that forced it to cancel thousands of flights
item.description: The airline on Thursday confirmed that it was pursuing legal claims against CrowdStrike and Microsoft Corp. to recover damages.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield dips as traders weigh state of U.S. economy after latest data
item.description: U.S. Treasury yields were slightly lower early Friday as investors continue to assess weekly jobless claims data.

item.title: S&P 500 posts biggest percentage gain since late 2022 as U.S. stocks end higher
German giant Siemens beat profit estimates on the back of AI boom and demand for electrification
item.description: Siemens had long been a producer of heavy industrial equipment but has in recent years sought to shift its focus towards digital technology and factory automation.

item.title: Friday's analyst calls: Yeti a buy after earnings, salad stock to rally 50%
item.description: An outdoor container maker and a salad chain were among the stocks being talked about by analysts on Friday.

item.title: Fed rate-cut fervor is gripping Wall Street again. It could be another trap.
